item.title: New 'Hunger Games' prequel reminds that sometimes past truths aren't visible
item.description: Sunrise on the Reaping recounts the 50th annual Hunger Games, telling the story of Haymitch Abernathy. It's themes and events conjure images of today's U.S. political climate.

item.title: Fast-er food: A productivity surge at U.S. restaurants
item.description: A new study finds that after decades of stagnation, fast-food and other restaurants finally saw a surge in productivity.

item.title: Trump tests executive power. And, hundreds killed in Israeli airstrikes on Gaza
item.description: A federal judge is requesting the DOJ give a sworn declaration about deportations over the weekend. And, Israel launched surprise airstrikes in Gaza early Tuesday, killing over 400.

item.title: This is why Canada has plenty of eggs — and the U.S. doesn't
item.description: While the U.S. grapples with an egg shortage caused by avian flu, eggs remain plentiful and affordable in Canada. There are reasons for that, including that egg farms there tend to be smaller.

item.title: 'Segregated facilities' are no longer explicitly banned in federal contracts
item.description: The Trump administration cut a clause from federal contracting rules that had been on the books since the 1960s: Companies are no longer explicitly prohibited from having segregated facilities.

item.title: Hundreds killed as Israel launches a series of airstrikes on Gaza
item.description: Israel said the Tuesday attacks were launched after Hamas refused to release more hostages held in Gaza. The strikes raise the prospect of a full resumption of war after a nearly two-month ceasefire.
